isis.stitle: International® DT 466E, DT 466, 530, 530E, and HT 530 Diesel Engines - Turbochargers - Clean, Inspect, and Test - Measure Actuator Movement

step1.para: Clamp turbocharger mounting flange in a vise and position Dial Indicator with Magnetic Base on frame of the vise. Place tip of Dial Indicator on actuator lever.
Connect air hose to 207 kPa (30 psi) pressure regulator.

Using hose, connect pressure regulator, note rod location (scribe mark). Gradually apply 197 kPa (29 psi)to the wastegate actuator. Measure actuator rod travel, compare to " Specification ," for actuator movement tolerance.

svcsubproc.title: Diagnosing Possible EVRT® Damage
svcsubproc.para: Should you suspect trouble with the EVRT®, note that there are several diagnostic procedures that must be followed in order to determine whether or not there is a problem with the EVRT®. These steps include completing the appended EGED-260 EVRT® Warranty Checklist, and the Performance Diagnostics side of EGED-220 Mechanical Diagnostics form.

note.para: Prior approval is required from International® Technical Services before turbocharger replacement under warranty. In order to be considered for warranty reimbursement, a completed EVRT® Warranty Checklist must be attached to the EVRT® when it is returned to International Truck and Engine Corporation.

step1.para: Orient EVRT® turbocharger assembly so that actuator linkage can be easily accessed and viewed.
Move the actuator shaft through its entire travel.
The actuator shaft should rotate 90° and return under spring tension.
